Title: Papyrus Anastasi 2
Description: Book of the Dead of Penmaat; frame 1; full colour offering-scene vignette; Hieratic text in red and black ink.
Curator's comments: Green in Davies, Colour and Painting, London 2001, p.44, col. pl. 9 [3] Nicholson and Shaw, Ancient Egyptian Materials and Technology (Cambridge 2000), p. 115, 116. Quirke, Stephen. 1993. Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (British Museum Occasional Papers 92), London.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (203)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (134524) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/134524)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Red ink Pigment Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: self adhesive tape, Filmoplast. Object Priority: A Mount Priority: D Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: good (damage at edges)
Acquisition notes: According to Quirke, Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (1993), 203, the papyrus was acquired during the third Anastasi sale of 1857. The sale catalogue of 1857 refers to six (closed) roles of papyrus. The other number 'anastasi 2' could refer to P. Anastasi 2, which is printed on frame 2. Note that also EA10243,1-4 is labeled P. Anastasi 2 (also by print on the frames 1, 3 and 4), however.
